question.body: To avoid these complications, some patients have a splenectomy (removal of the spleen). What other impacts would a removal of the spleen have?

response.feedback: Correct. The spleen is a lymph organ, which aids in immunity. loss of the spleen can lead to increased infection.
Incorrect. Even though the spleen is in the region with other digestive organs, it is a lymphatic organ.
Incorrect. The urinary system will often process the products of the spleen, but the spleen does not directly impact the uirinary system.
Incorrect. The spleen is primarily a lymphatic organ, and it has only minimal endocrine function.

part.hint: The spleen is an organ of the lymphatic system.
